page.title: 18A day in an adult's life
page.content: I wake up at dawn to the singing of the birds.Between 7-8am I see my son, who is a meat inspector in Stowmarket, and my daughter,an environmental health officer in Ipswich,off to work.Before breakfast,I take my dog for a walk across the fields.By 8.30 the milk,post and papers are delivered.My husband and I have breakfast,then I walk into Lavenham to do my shopping at the Post Office,Co-Op,greengrocers, bakers and butchers.On Tuesdays I collect fish and chips from the van on the Market Place.After lunch I do my housework,read the papers and do the gardening.Then I prepare dinner for my family.By 6pm I am on my way out to a tennis match.We usually stop for drinks on the way home at one of the local pubs.Back home I watch the television news and a late night play.
